required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Study of ATR-101 in Subjects With Advanced Adrenocortical Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Study of the Safety and Tolerability of ATR-101 in Adrenocortical Carcinoma

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This first-in-human study is designed to establish the safety and tolerability of ATR-101 in patients with advanced adrenocortical carcinoma whose tumor has progressed on standard therapy. Information will also be collected to determine how long ATR-101 stays in the blood, and if any effect on tumor progression is seen. Biomarkers (blood and urine tests) will determine if any effects on production of steroid hormones (cortisol, aldosterone, estrogen and testosterone) are seen.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of dose-limiting toxicity and determination of maximum tolerated dose
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be recorded and tabulated by grade and system organ class according to CTCAE v 4.03. Laboratory measures and ECGs will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of ATR-101
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma levels of ATR-101 will be assessed after daily oral dosing and pharmacokinetic parameters will be calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in objective measurement of tumor size
secondary_outcome.description: CT or MRI scans will be read according to RECIST 1.1

arm_group.description: ATR-101 will be administered as capsules by mouth once per day to ascending dose cohorts
